channel.title: What if... Black holes!
channel.description:
What if in the center of every star/planet there is a black hole. This black hole pulls everything towards it and stays intact because of the earth/fire/whatever surrounding it. Maybe black holes are made of matter which could explain why when smaller stars/planets blow up they don't leave black holes (because the black hole is too small to sustain itself and the matter escapes). But if the star/planet was HUGE then maybe it can't escape it's own pull and stays.
This could explain gravity and why things are pushed towards the center of planets or stars.
Finally, my theory to where black holes go! I think that if you go in a black hole you will end up somewhere else. Maybe another dimension. Otherwise, the black hole might be just like a funnel and you end up at the end of it. Matter can't be destroyed so maybe if a black hole gets too full it will blow up and make smaller black holes with matter around them (NEW PLENETS LULS). And this energy can cause fire. Also the atoms can change as they are seperated, crushed, etc under the uber force!
I r very interested in black holes. Discuss your theories on black holes!

item.title: What if... Black holes!
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“swotrain, post:15, topic:210235”]I think that all they can do is like “teleport” people. (ya nice word for it) But if you think about, if we can be seperated into particles then we could go anywhere relly fast which could be what a black hole does…?

And isn’t that theory in charley and the choclate factory or something, or one of they’re little inventions…?[/quote]
A black hole is a strong force of gravity that leads to an unknown destination in time and space it would spread the human body out into approximately 200m of spaghetti and suck you in at varying speeds it does not teleport its like digging a tunnel it goes to one place unless you leave the hole early

item.title: What if... Black holes!
item.dc:creator: @skiller_noob1 skiller noob1
item.description:
@skiller_noob1 wrote:

[quote=“ThAt0n36Uy, post:12, topic:210235”]skiller noob1, go die. The Bermuda Triangle is affected by hydrogen gas pockets underneath the sea floor. They release and cause barometric pressure to go erratic, that’s why planes crash, they don’t know the correct altitude. Ships sink, because the gas pockets release underneath the ocean, but because water is much heavier than gasses the release causes buoyancy to disappear, causing the ships to sink.[/quote]I was just posting something I saw on a show. So, you don’t need to flame me for no damn reason.

item.title: What if... Black holes!
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

skiller noob1:

This theroy is possibly correct. This is known as the Bermuda Triangle, this the reason compasses get fucked up, black holes have a magnetic poll. It turns of eletric devices. This was on a T.V. show I watched on chanell 45.

This theory has no solid evidence to suggest it to even be possible, all mass has gravity in space a big enough space station with nothing around for lightyears will act like a planet and you will be pulled towards it the only reason such thing doesn’t exist to us is because we are too close to a big source of gravity: the sun and the earth. As the bemuda triangle that has fuck all to do with this

item.title: What if... Black holes!
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

skiller noob1, go die. The Bermuda Triangle is affected by hydrogen gas pockets underneath the sea floor. They release and cause barometric pressure to go erratic, that’s why planes crash, they don’t know the correct altitude. Ships sink, because the gas pockets release underneath the ocean, but because water is much heavier than gasses the release causes buoyancy to disappear, causing the ships to sink.

Read full topic

item.title: What if... Black holes!
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Ok, let’s suppose for a minute there is a black hole at the center of the Earth. Fine. Ok, now rewind time a few billion years, when there is a cloud of dust and crap where Earth would eventually be. There is no black hole here. How and when did it get there ?

Read full topic

item.title: What if... Black holes!
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

[quote=“counterp4545, post:1, topic:210243”]You got solid proof? Link me.

How is this trying to be ‘cute or funny’[/quote]

en.wikipedia.org

Structure of the Earth

The internal structure of the Earth is layered in spherical shells: an outer silicate solid crust, a highly viscous asthenosphere and mantle, a liquid outer core that is much less viscous than the mantle, and a solid inner core. Scientific understanding of the internal structure of the Earth is based on observations of topography and bathymetry, observations of rock in outcrop, samples brought to the surface from greater depths by volcanoes or volcanic activity, analysis of the seismic waves that...

It can be proven by detecting waves and shit sent through the earth. I don’t do physics anymore but the earth’s core is definitely Iron and Nickel. Go back to school kid.
